column4: everytime i try to send someone a file in xchat it times out, can anyone help me?
you have a router that does NAT.
but i have the ports that i use in xchat, routed in the router
those ports being what, 6667? that's not the port for DCCs
http://www.irchelp.org/irchelp/security/fwfaq.html#14
im using ports 10051 to 10070 and they r routed to my ip
ill take a look at that, thx
then it ought to work, if your IRC client is really using those ports... you aren't using some firewalling software or something like that?
i have nothing, at least i dont think so
try sending me a random file
it's trying to send to port 10051 indeed
so wut else might be wrong? iptables?
if you've never added any rules to iptables, no
nope
i'm portscanning you by the way - no harm intended of course, i'm just trying to see if i can find a clue
k
nevermind, i think i know y, i have one adsl modem that connects to adsl and to the router, this modem is not forwarding the port to the router
try typing "netcat -l -p 10051" (this will instruct your computer to listen for incoming TCP connections on port 10051 - tell me when you've typed this, i'll try to connect manually)
oh, if the modem is itself a router, that'll be it yeah
duh such a simple thin, i forgot to forward on that modem
thx
i think i fixed the port forwarding prob, can i try to send u a file to c?
